verses.text: 有幾個人從猶太下來，教導弟兄們說：「你們若不照摩西的規例受割禮，就不能得救。」

words.note: Used in the Bible to refer to fellow Christians.
Refers to the religious ritual of circumcision.

verses.text: 保羅和巴拿巴，與他們大大地爭執辯論起來。大家就派保羅、巴拿巴和他們中間的幾個人，為這個問題上耶路撒冷去見使徒和長老。

words.note: Refers to church leaders or respected older members.

verses.text: 於是教會給他們送行，他們就經過腓尼基、撒瑪利亞，述說外族人怎樣歸主的事，使弟兄們大大喜樂。

words.note: Refers to non-Jewish people, a key term in the Bible.
A common biblical term for deep spiritual joy.

verses.text: 到了耶路撒冷，他們受到教會、使徒和長老的接待，就報告 神同他們一起所行的一切。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Indicates the following verb is the object of a preceding verb or part of a noun clause.

verses.text: 然而有幾個法利賽派的信徒站起來，說：「我們必須給外族人行割禮，吩咐他們遵守摩西的律法。」

words.note: Refers to the religious and political Jewish group, the Pharisees.

verses.text: 使徒和長老聚集在一起，商議這件事。

words.note: Lit. 'sent follower'
Lit. 'senior old [person]'

verses.text: 經過了很多的辯論，彼得站起來對他們說：「弟兄們，你們知道，前些時候 神在你們中間揀選了我，使外族人從我的口中聽見福音的道，而且信了。

words.note: Commonly used for fellow Christians.
The elevated character '　' indicates reverence for 'God' in Bible translations.
Often used in a theological sense for divine selection.
Often used idiomatically for 'from what one says'.
Lit. 'blessed news'.
In religious context, refers to teaching or divine truth.
Here implies spiritual belief, not just trust.

verses.text: 知道人心的 神也為他們作證──賜聖靈給他們，像給我們一樣；

words.note: Refers to inner thoughts, intentions, or spiritual state.
The elevated character '　' indicates reverence for 'God' in Bible translations.
Formal or elevated term for 'give'.
Lit. 'holy spirit'.

verses.text: 而且他待他們和我們沒有分別，因為藉著信，他潔淨了他們的心。

words.note: Formal equivalent of 透過 (tòuguò).
Here, 'faith' in a religious sense.
Often used in a spiritual or ceremonial sense.
Refers to the inner spiritual or moral being.

verses.text: 現在你們為甚麼試探 神，把我們祖先和我們所不能負的軛，放在門徒的頸上呢？

words.note: Often used in the context of tempting God or being tempted by evil.
The elevated character '　' indicates reverence for 'God' in Bible translations.
Used to form a noun phrase from a verb, often implying 'that which is...'
Often used for bearing burdens or responsibilities.
Figuratively, a burden or oppressive system.
Lit. 'door follower,' referring to a student or adherent.
Used as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 我們相信，我們得救是藉著主耶穌的恩，和他們也是一樣。」

words.note: Lit. 'mutually believe'
Lit. 'obtain salvation'
Used as a title for God or Jesus.

verses.text: 大家都靜默無聲，聽巴拿巴和保羅述說 神藉著他們在外族人中所行的神蹟奇事。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'silent and still, without a sound'.
Describes telling a story or event.
The leading space is an honorific in some Chinese Bibles.
Refers to non-Jewish people in a biblical context.
Often follows a noun to indicate 'amongst' or 'within'.
Forms a nominal phrase, like 'that which is done'.
A common biblical compound for miraculous events.

verses.text: 他們講完了，雅各說：「弟兄們，請聽我說！

words.note: Lit. 'younger and older brothers', meaning 'brethren'.

verses.text: 剛才西門述說 神當初怎樣關懷外族人，從他們中間揀選了眾人，歸在自己的名下。

words.note: Describes telling a story or event.
The leading space is an honorific in some Chinese Bibles.
To show concern and care for someone.
Refers to non-Jewish people in a biblical context.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for divine selection.
Lit. 'many people' or 'the multitude'.
Means 'under the authority/jurisdiction of one's name'.

verses.text: 眾先知的話，也符合這個意思，正如經上所記：

words.note: Refers to 'all the prophets' as a collective group.
Lit. 'on the scripture'; refers to written scripture.
Forms a nominal phrase, like 'that which is recorded'.

verses.text: 『此後我要回來，重建大衛倒塌了的帳幕，重建它損壞之處，把它重新豎立起來，

words.note: A portable sanctuary or dwelling.
Classical Chinese possessive/modifying particle.

verses.text: 使餘下的人，就是所有稱為我名下的外族人，都尋求主，

words.note: Implies ownership, authority, or association.
Non-Jewish people in a biblical context.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 這是自古以來就顯明了這些事的主所說的。』

words.note: An idiom meaning 'from time immemorial'.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ.
Indicates the preceding noun is the agent of the following verb.

verses.text: 「所以我認為不可難為這些歸服 神的外族人，

words.note: To become a follower or believer.
An honorific space used before sacred names like 'God'.
Non-Jewish people in a biblical context.

verses.text: 只要寫信叫他們禁戒偶像的污穢、淫亂，勒死的牲畜和血。

words.note: An image or object worshipped as a deity.
Ritual or moral impurity, often related to sin.
Any illicit or immoral sexual conduct.
Often used as an adjective for meat from strangled animals.

verses.text: 因為自古以來，在各城裡都有人宣講摩西的書，每逢安息日，在各會堂裡都有人誦讀。」

words.note: Common in religious contexts, less so in everyday speech.

verses.text: 當時，使徒、長老和全教會都認為好，就從他們中間選出人來，差他們和保羅、巴拿巴一同到安提阿去，所選的就是別號巴撒巴的猶大和西拉，他們是弟兄中的領袖。

words.note: Literally 'sent disciple'.
Refers to church elders in this context.
Literally 'teaching assembly'.
Used for fellow believers in the Bible.

verses.text: 於是寫信給他們帶去，信上說：「使徒和作長老的弟兄們，向安提阿、敘利亞、基利家的外族眾弟兄問安。

words.note: Refers to non-Jewish people, particularly in a biblical context.

verses.text: 我們聽說有人從我們這裡出去，說了一些話攪擾你們，使你們心裡不安，其實我們並沒有吩咐他們。

words.note: Both characters are typically used in this compound.

verses.text: 因此，我們一致同意，選派一些人跟我們親愛的巴拿巴和保羅去見你們，
這兩個人為了我們主耶穌基督的名，曾經把性命置之度外。

words.note: Often combined with 為 (wèi) to form 為了 (wèile), 'for the sake of'
Capitalized when referring to God/Jesus
An idiom meaning to put one's life outside consideration, i.e., disregard danger.

verses.text: 我們派了猶大和西拉一同去，他們也會親口述說這些事。
聖靈和我們都同意，不把別的重擔加在你們身上，然而有幾件事是重要的，

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit in Christianity.

verses.text: 就是禁戒祭過偶像的食物、血、勒死的牲畜和淫亂。這些事你們若能保守自己不作，那就好了。祝你們平安！」

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts.
Describes animals that were strangled and not properly bled.

verses.text: 他們受了差派，下安提阿去，集合了眾人，就把書信交上。

words.note: Can also be a verb: to send on a mission.

verses.text: 眾人讀了，因信上的勸勉，就感到欣慰。

words.note: Indicates completed action.
Often used in religious context for spiritual encouragement.

verses.text: 猶大和西拉也是先知，說了許多話勸勉弟兄，堅固他們。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Used as a verb here, 'to encourage'.
Refers to fellow believers.
Often used for strengthening faith or resolve in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 住了一段時間，弟兄們就給他們送行，祝一路平安；他們就回到差派他們的人那裡去。

words.note: Commonly used in farewells, '一路平安' means 'have a safe journey'.

verses.text: （有些抄本在此有第34節：「但西拉認為自己應當在那裡住下來，只有猶大回到耶路撒冷。」）
保羅和巴拿巴卻住在安提阿，跟許多別的人一同教導，傳講主的道。

words.note: Commonly used for proclaiming the gospel or God's word.
Refers to Jesus Christ or God.
In biblical context, refers to God's word, truth, or the Way of salvation.

verses.text: 過了一些時候，保羅對巴拿巴說：「我們要回到我們傳過主道的各城，探望弟兄們，好知道他們的情形怎麼樣。」

words.note: Refers to the message or teaching of the Lord.
Often refers to fellow believers in a religious context.

verses.heading: Paul and Barnabas Part Company

verses.text: 巴拿巴有意要帶別號馬可的約翰一同去，
但保羅認為不應帶他去，因為他從前在旁非利亞離開過他們，不跟他們一起去作工。
他們各持己見，以致彼此分手。巴拿巴帶著馬可，坐船到塞浦路斯去；

words.note: An idiom meaning to disagree.

words.definition: with the result that, so that

words.note: Lit. 'separate hands'.

verses.text: 保羅卻選了西拉，眾弟兄把他交託在主的恩典中之後，他就出發了。

words.note: Often refers to fellow believers in a religious context.
Introduces object before verb.

verses.text: 他走遍了敘利亞、基利家，堅固眾教會。

words.note: Verb-complement construction indicating exhaustive action.
Often precedes nouns to mean 'all/many of a group'.
Literally 'teaching assembly'.
